page.title: 04RELIGION
page.content: There are two C.E. churches in our area and one methodist chapel.The church in Steeple Ashton is St.Mary's and was built in the early 16th century and the church in Keevil is St.Leonard's,and was built in the early 14th century.They both share the same vicar.The St.Mary's church is very big as Steeple Ashton used to be a big town,but it became a village after a fire,in the 16th century .The Methodist Chapel shares a minister with other local Methodist Chapels.At one time there used to be a Baptist Chapel in Steeple Ashton:also,starting in 1849,a good many people left Steeple Ashton for the U.S.A.where they were able to worship as members of the Mormon Church.Other denominations,mainly R.C and Baptists are catered for in various nearby towns.
